message:
Here lies Lawellyn the weak.
Survived by Arlish
['Survived by Arlish'.  You wonder if this is the person that you should talk to.]
Why?  What do you know about it?

replies.text: Well, I have it right here.
Well, I have it right here.
You have looked at the dagger. Can you tell me more?
I was just curious, I was told that a dagger I had was Lawellyn's, but I no longer have it.
Nothing. I was just curious. Bye.

message: [Arlish takes the dagger and examines it while you continue to talk]

replies.text: I was able to acquire the dagger and it's gem. Then Edrin repaired it for me.

message: This can't be it. It looks like my father's dagger, but his dagger has been missing for a couple of years now. I believe this is stolen property!

replies.text: Tell me more.
So what.  You said it has been missing for years, so how would you know?

message: You see, this was my father Lawellyn's most prized possesion. He kept it with him always.

replies.text: Please go on.

message: Then one night, father did not come to my place for dinner as was the custom.  I quickly became worried that something terrible had happened to him. So I went to Mustura for help, but she quickly pushed it off as 'Lawellyn simply went on a trip'.

replies.text: N

message: Yes. I fear he was murdered. Will you help?

replies.text: Yes.  Of course I will.  You are in need.
I'm sorry, but I just don't have the time.

message: But I tried to explain to her that Lawellyn would not do so without telling me.

replies.text: That sounds suspicious.  Would you like me to investigate a little?

message: Oh thank you so much.
I'm sorry to hear this.
Well, he did have a dagger, but I can't say if the one you had was his if I can't look at it.
No, I am sorry, I don't
I may.  Who's asking?

replies.text: Well, I've been asked by Lawellyn's daughter, Arlish, to investigate his death.

message: Oh, OK.  Arlish helped me a lot in school when we were kids, so I feel like I owe it to her to help you.

replies.text: N

message:
Don't tell the bartender, but I like to frequent the tavern in Loneford a lot, and as such, I've developed quite a friendship with the owner Kizzo. One day we were talking about how scary the woods between Loneford and Brimhaven can be at nighttime.  After sharing some
not so scary stories, Kizzo told me a crazy murder story.  Now I can't remember the details because...well, I had been drinking.

replies.text: N

message: I suggest that you go talk to Kizzo.
Oh, yes. A couple of years ago, a customer that I've never seen before nor have I seen since, sits down at the bar with a terrified look on his face.

replies.text: N

message: He begins to tell me that he just witnessed two men in the woods between here and Brimhaven embroiled in a violent altercation and fears that one killed the other.

replies.text: N

message: That's all I know.  Maybe you could find out more if you can find the crime scene?
Wow!  This glove looks like it's been through a lot.

replies.text: N

message: This does however look like it used to be a high quality item.

replies.text: Really?

message: Yes.  If that was my glove, I would have tried to get a new one made instead of buying a new set as it would be cheaper.

replies.text: Where would someone get just one glove?

message: Well, I know Venanra in Brimhaven does some great work with cloth and leather items.
[Upon inspection, you notice what appears to be leather peeking out from under some leaves. You pull at it, and find a glove. It has what look like old blood stains on it.]
What's that on the ground?

replies.text: Look closer.
Ignore it.

message: Well, yes, I have. In fact, I made one exactly like it a couple of years ago for a customer. I remember because it is a very unique looking glove.

replies.text: Can you remember who the customer was?

message: Um, let me think for a second...ah, yes, it was for Ogea.

replies.text: N

message: He came to me with a story that he lost his glove while hunting one night and how he wanted me to make him a replacement as he could not efford to purchase a new pair.

replies.text: Are you sure?

message: Oh, absolutly I'm sure.
I'm sure you think that, but do you have any proof?

replies.text: In fact, I do! I have physical evidence that proves you killed him.

message: What?! What do you have on me that would even make Mustura listen to you?

replies.text: I have a blood-stained glove and a witness stating that it was indeed your glove. [Show Ogea his glove.]

message: What can I say?  You have me.

replies.text: Well, you can start by explaining what happened.

message: Yes, I'd like to.

replies.text: N

message: The story starts many years ago. I was a struggling woodcutter in need of land to build my home on.

replies.text: N

message: I approached Lawellyn about it because he was responsible for land deeds, so I asked him about acquiring some empty land where Alkapoan's house now stands. He informed me that he was giving it to Alkapoan.

replies.text: N

message: I thought that that land was too large for just one house, but Lawellyn said 'no'.  We argued about it for many months, until one day our paths crossed just outside of town.

replies.text: Get to the point where you killed the man and left his daughter without a father.

message: In another attempt to change Lawellyn's mind on giving me land to build my house, things got real ugly real fast.  I don't know why he reached for his dagger, but I saw this and drew my weapon in self-defense.  I had no intention of killing him!  I was trying to defend myself.  Do you believe me?

replies.text: Yes
No.  In fact, I want do know more.  Like, what did you do with Lawellyn's dagger?

message: I'm glad to hear it.  Thank you.
Well, after the fight, I noticed that the gem broke off of it.  I took both the gem and the dagger and sold them to a thief.  So all I'm guilty of is selling stolen property.

replies.text: I don't think so.  You should expect a visit from Mustura real soon.

message: What about it?

replies.text: I'm sorry, but I was not able to find any new information that would determine what happened to your father.
N

message: I'm sorry too. Thank you for tyring.
I should have known that it was Ogea!  He never agreed with my father's decision about the land.

replies.text: N

message: It would be my honor if you take Lawellyn's dagger.  He would want you to have it.

replies.text: Thank you, but it was my honor to help bring you closure and justice.

message: Let me hear it.

replies.text: I found his glove at the crime scene covered in dried blood and a witness that says the glove is Ogea's.  Ogea's also admitted that he stole the dagger.

message: Wow.  You did a great job!  Do you want a job on my team?

replies.text: No, thanks.  I just want Ogea puhished.

message: That is as good as done

replies.text: Thanks.

message: I heard that you found my father's murderer.

replies.text: N

message: I 'look like someone that may be able to help'.  What is that supposed to mean?

replies.text: Um...I mean let's be honest, you may be someone who likes to play on the other side of the law.

message: You got that right, kid. Now what do you want to know?

replies.text: I'm wondering, do you know anything about Lawellyn's death?

message: If you want to know about a murder, you should probably ask on the east side of town.
